info.title: Associations
info.description: Associations define the relationships between objects in HubSpot. These endpoints allow you to create, read, and remove associations.
info.x-hubspot-api-use-case: When an existing contact has moved to a new company, update their associated company to keep your CRM up to date.
info.x-hubspot-introduction: Use the associations API to create, retrieve, update, or delete associations between records, or between records and activities.

parameters.name: fromObjectType
parameters.description: The type of the object from which associations will be created.

parameters.name: toObjectType
parameters.description: The type of the object to which associations will be created.

parameters.name: fromObjectType
parameters.description: The type of the object from which associations will be read.

parameters.name: toObjectType
parameters.description: The type of the object to which associations will be read.

parameters.name: fromObjectType
parameters.description: The type of the object from which associations will be removed.

parameters.name: toObjectType
parameters.description: The type of the object to which associations will be removed.

id.description: The unique ID that identifies an object.

subCategory.description: A more specific error category within each main category.

context.description: Additional context-specific information related to the error.

links.description: URLs linking to documentation or resources associated with the error.

id.description: A unique ID for the error instance.

category.description: The main category of the error.

message.description: A human-readable string describing the error and possible remediation steps.

status.description: The HTTP status code associated with the error.

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error
subCategory.example: {"message":"Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)","correlationId":"aeb5f871-7f07-4993-9211-075dc63e7cbf","category":"VALIDATION_ERROR","links":{"knowledge-base":"https://www.hubspot.com/products/service/knowledge-base"}}

context.example: {"message":"Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)","correlationId":"aeb5f871-7f07-4993-9211-075dc63e7cbf","category":"VALIDATION_ERROR","links":{"knowledge-base":"https://www.hubspot.com/products/service/knowledge-base"}}

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate
message.example: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

errors.example: {"message":"Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)","correlationId":"aeb5f871-7f07-4993-9211-075dc63e7cbf","category":"VALIDATION_ERROR","links":{"knowledge-base":"https://www.hubspot.com/products/service/knowledge-base"}}

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

to.description: The IDs of objects that are associated with the object identified by the ID in 'from'.

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

before.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving previous pages.

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the previous pages' results.

PreviousPage.description: specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the previous set of results in a paginated API response

id.description: The ID for the association type.

AssociatedId.description: Contains the id and type of an association

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the next page results.

after.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving subsequent pages.

NextPage.description: Specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the next set of results in a paginated API response
